task.summary:
gradle wrapper --gradle-version 4.9
after executing this command these files were generated.
I have executed this command because I got the following error: Could not determine Java version using executable C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-10.0.1\bin\java.exe.
and I followed the instructions on these stackoverflow entry: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50121333/could-not-determine-java-version-using-executable-c-program-files-java-jdk-10-0

just executed "Refresh all gradle projects" after configuring gradle 4.9. As a consequence the "Could not determine Java version using executable C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-10.0.1\bin\java.exe. " problem stopped happening
does it generate a new file each time I run "Refresh all gradle projects" ?

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50121333/could-not-determine-java-version-using-executable-c-program-files-java-jdk-10-0
Next step, is to make sure that IntelliJ IDEA uses those, instead of built-in Gradle distribution and you can do this by opening IntelliJ preferences and search for "gradle" (this will be in "Build, Execution, Deployment / Build Tools / Gradle").
In this section of the settings select:
Select Use gradle wrapper task configuration
Apply changes, press ok and re-build (re-sync) Gradle and everything should be fine. I hope this helps.

Going back to JDK 8 fixed all the reamining problems.
JDK 10 is not fully compatible with all this process.
At this point I got to run and see the sample plugin working.
DRAFT: Temos um botao no click direito do mouse!!! e j conseguimos modificar o texto selecionado!!!
DRAFT: J temos ele criando o load de forma generica;
DRAFT: J temos ele criando o load de forma generica;
DRAFT: J temos ele criando o load de forma generica;

after executing this command these files were generated.
I have executed this command because I got the following error: Could not determine Java version using executable C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-10.0.1\bin\java.exe.
and I followed the instructions on these stackoverflow entry: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50121333/could-not-determine-java-version-using-executable-c-program-files-java-jdk-10-0

just executed "Refresh all gradle projects" after configuring gradle 4.9. As a consequence the "Could not determine Java version using executable C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-10.0.1\bin\java.exe. " problem stopped happening
does it generate a new file each time I run "Refresh all gradle projects" ?

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50121333/could-not-determine-java-version-using-executable-c-program-files-java-jdk-10-0
Next step, is to make sure that IntelliJ IDEA uses those, instead of built-in Gradle distribution and you can do this by opening IntelliJ preferences and search for "gradle" (this will be in "Build, Execution, Deployment / Build Tools / Gradle").
In this section of the settings select:
Select Use gradle wrapper task configuration
Apply changes, press ok and re-build (re-sync) Gradle and everything should be fine. I hope this helps.

Going back to JDK 8 fixed all the reamining problems.
JDK 10 is not fully compatible with all this process.
At this point I got to run and see the sample plugin working.
